{{Infobox National Political Convention | year = 2012 | party = Republican | logo = | logo_size = 75px | image = | image2 = St Pete Times Forum At Sunset.jpg | image_size2 = 250px | caption = The [[St. Pete Times Forum]] will host the 2012 Republican National Convention | date = August 27, 2012 - August 30, 2012 | venue = [[St. Pete Times Forum]] | city = [[Tampa]], [[Florida]] | speakers = TBD | presidential_nominee = TBD | vice_presidential_nominee = TBD | previous_year = 2008 | next_year = 2016 | ballots = TBD | totaldelegates = TBD | votesneeded = 50% + 1 of total | presidenttotals = TBD | vicepresidenttotals = TBD }} The [[United States]] '''2012 Republican National Convention''', in which [[Delegate#Politics|delegates]] of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] will choose the party's nominees for [[President of the United States]] and [[Vice President of the United States]], will be held during the week of August 27, 2012, in [[Tampa, Florida]]Ambinder, Marc (March 3, 2010) [http://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2010/03/2012-news-rnc-has-its-convention-date/36950/ "2012 News: RNC Has Its Convention Date"], The Atlantic. Retrieved March 3, 2010. at the [[St. Pete Times Forum]]. On August 14, 2009, the [[Republican National Committee]] named a 13 person [[Site selection|Site Selection]] Committee to start the process of selecting a host city for the [[United States presidential election, 2012|2012]] convention.[http://www.demconwatchblog.com/diary/2175/gop-names-2012-site-selection-committee "GOP names 2012 site selection committee"], DemConWatchblog.com. Retrieved August 17, 2009. News reports in early 2010 indicated that Tampa as well as [[Salt Lake City|Salt Lake City, Utah]], and [[Phoenix, Arizona]], had been selected as finalist candidates for the convention site.{{cite web|url=http://www.demconwatchblog.com/diary/3124/salt-lake-1-of-4-finalists-for-2012-republican-convention|title=Salt Lake 1 of 4 finalists for 2012 Republican Convention|publisher=DemConWatchblog.com. 30 January 2010|accessdate=31 January 2010}}{{cite news|url=http://www.azcentral.com/news/articles/2010/02/01/20100201phoenix-finalist-for-gop-convention-2012-ON.html|title=Phoenix 1 of 4 finalists for 2012 GOP Convention|date=2010-02-01|accessdate=2010-02-01|publisher=The Arizona Republic}} The decision was announced on May 12, 2010, when Tampa was selected as the host city.Lush, Tamara (May 12, 2010) [http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hvykQk2JmbjJkL_pptPLpVf1zHCgD9FLQBRO0 "Tampa wins bid to host 2012 GOP convention"], [[The Associated Press]].
